required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of BIBB 515 BS and Effect of Food After Oral Administration in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Single-dose Pharmacokinetics of 2.5 mg BIBB 515 BS and Effect of Food After Oral Administration of Capsules to Healthy Subjects (Randomized, 2-way-cross-over, Open Study)

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of a breakfast (40 g fat) on single dose pharmacokinetics of a 2.5 mg BIBB 515 dose in capsules as well as the tolerability of BIBB 515 BS capsules

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum concentration of the analyte in plasma (tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent terminal elimination half-life of the analyte in plasma (t1/2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma at different time points (AUC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Total mean residence time of the analyte in the body (MRTtot)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent clearance of the analyte in plasma after extravascular multiple dose administration (CL/f)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution of the analyte during the terminal phase (Vz/f)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Terminal rate constant of the analyte in plasma (λz)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 48 hours after last drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Global clinical assessment by the investigator

arm_group.arm_group_label: BIBB 515 BS after a standard breakfast

intervention.arm_group_label: BIBB 515 BS after a standard breakfast
BIBB 515 BS after a standard breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male caucasian subjects as determined by results of screening
- Written informed consent in accordance with good clinical practice (GCP) and local legislation
- Age ≥ 18 and ≤ 50 years
- Broca ≥ - 20 % and ≤ + 20 %
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and ECG) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Gastrointestinal, hepatic, renal, respiratory, cardiovascular, metabolic, immunological or hormonal disorders
- Surgery of gastrointestinal tract (except appendectomy)
- Diseases of the central nervous system (such as epilepsy) or psychiatric disorders or neurologic disorders
- History of orthostatic hypotension, fainting spells or blackouts
- Chronic or relevant acute infections
- History of allergy/hypersensitivity (including drug allergy) which is deemed relevant to the trial as judged by the investigator
- Intake of drugs with a long half-life (> 24 hours) (≤ 1 month prior to administration or during the trial)
- Use of any drugs which might influence the results of the trial (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Participation in another trial with an investigational drug (≤ 2 months prior to administration or during the trial)
- Smoker (> 10 cigarettes or > 3 cigars or > 3 pipes/day)
- Inability to refrain from smoking on study days
- Alcohol abuse (> 60 g/day)
- Drug abuse
- Blood donation > 100 ml (≤ 4 weeks prior to administration or during the trial)
- Excessive physical activities (≤ 10 days prior to administration or during the trial)
- Any laboratory value outside the reference range of clinical relevance
